title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Officer Scott MacIsaac died of cancer on Friday after serving Boston police for over 30 years.
MacIsaac joined Boston Police Department in 1995 and recently worked in West Roxbury; he was an Army veteran.
He was honored for his role during the Boston Marathon bombings and several life-saving incidents.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman and Andrei Vasilevskiy engaged in a rare goalie fight during an NHL Stadium Series game in Tampa.
The fight occurred in front of over 64,000 fans, resulting in major penalties for both goalies during Boston's 6-5 shootout loss.
After the game, the goalies exchanged words and hugs, with Swayman describing the fight as 'game respecting game.'

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, charged with murder in shooting deaths of Elizabeth and Nicholas Almeida in Fall River.
Cole faces two murder counts and unlawful firearm possession after the Friday night Barnes Street incident.
Police found Cole at the scene; he was in a relationship with victim Elizabeth Almeida.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 skiers were rescued from a malfunctioning lift at Dartmouth Skiway in Lyme Center, New Hampshire.
Lyme, Hanover, and Thetford fire departments collaborated to evacuate skiers in under an hour and a half.
One skier was hospitalized, while others were checked for injuries and taken to the main lodge to warm up.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Mass. State Sen. Dean Tran was sentenced to 11 months for obstruction and false statements, 10 months concurrent with his sentence.
Tran was initially sentenced to 18 months in February 2025 for fraudulently collecting pandemic unemployment and omitting income on tax returns.
In addition to fraud charges, Tran faced allegations of violating state ethics laws and was involved in a gun theft incident from an elderly woman.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten scored eight goals in 14 games to earn NHL Rookie of the Month for January.
Acquired from Maple Leafs, Minten leads all rookies with 14 points in January, contributing to Bruins' 11-2-1 record.
Bruins face Lightning without top centers, Minten to play vital role in the Stadium Series matchup.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Seven crew members are presumed dead after the 72-foot fishing vessel Lily Jean sank off Gloucester.
The U.S. Coast Guard searched 1,000 square miles but suspended the search after finding an unresponsive body and life raft.
Victims include Captain Gus Sanfilippo, Sean Therrien, John Paul Rousanidis, Jada Samitt, Paul Beal, Paul Beal Jr., and Freeman Short.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins wore colonial-era Patriots costumes before their game against the Lightning at Raymond James Stadium.
All Bruins players participated, with personalized costumes supplied by Boston Costume, inspired by Boston's historical ties.
The Tampa Bay Lightning wore classic Buccaneers 'Creamsicle' uniforms, aligning with the game's themed attire.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to the White Sox, alongside pitching prospect David Sandlin.
Boston receives minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl and sends cash to Chicago as part of the deal.
Hicks, part of a 2025 blockbuster trade, struggled with an 8.20 ERA in 18.2 innings for Boston.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: The 'Something in the Way' festival opened with indie bands performing at Roadrunner in Boston.
Bands performing included The Hotelier, Her New Knife, and Momma at the Roadrunner venue.
Photographer Ben Stas captured performances for Boston.com at the two-day indie music festival.
